intro: Sorindeia calabarensis, commonly known as the Calabar sorindeia, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its bark is thick and fibrous. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
